maml:description.maml:para: Adds users into Active Directory group
Adds users into an Active Directory group, and also records the Ticket ID into a SQL database table for audit purposes
The user account to be added to the group
The Active Directory group to be modified
An integer value representing the helpdesk ticket
The SQL Database that houses the GroupMembershipLog table
The name of the database server (or CNAME alias) that houses the sqlDatabase
The resulting object from the get-GroupInfo function

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> get-GroupInfo 'Server Admin' | add-GroupMember -samAccountName bogus1 -ticketID 1234

maml:description.maml:para: Generates hash between two files

Path to the source file
Path to the target file

Used to determine if two files are identical

Converts a DataRow Object into a psObject

This function converts a SQL/Oracle Datarow object into a psObject. This is helpful when returning large results and the use of PS1XML files to define the default displays rendered by format-table, format-list, etc...
This is the dataRow object array
This is the type name of the object that will be returned
This is the dataRow object array
This is the type name of the object that will be returned
Converts a Decimal IP address into a 32-bit unsigned integer.
ConvertTo-DecimalIP takes a decimal IP, uses a shift-like operation on each octet and returns a single UInt32 value.
An IP Address to convert.
An IP Address to convert.
Returns a dotted decimal IP address from either an unsigned 32-bit integer or a dotted binary string.
ConvertTo-DottedDecimalIP uses a regular expression match on the input string to convert to an IP address.
A string representation of an IP address from either UInt32 or dotted binary.
A string representation of an IP address from either UInt32 or dotted binary.
Returns a dotted decimal subnet mask from a mask length.

ConvertTo-Mask returns a subnet mask in dotted decimal format from an integer value ranging between 0 and 32. ConvertTo-Mask first creates a binary string from the length, converts that to an unsigned 32-bit integer then calls ConvertTo-DottedDecimalIP to complete the operation.
The number of bits which must be masked.
The number of bits which must be masked.
Exports Wireless Network Profiles
Exports one or all wireless network profiles via the NetSh command
The profile to be exported
This switch will export all profiles found
The profile to be exported
This switch will export all profiles found
Gets focused account status information
Collects information on a specific user account, most for determine account status items, such as: - Password Age - Password Last Set - Bad Password Attempts - etc
The account to retrieve

A switch value that will collect from ALL domain controls. In large environments, this may take some time to complete. It his highly recommended that you set $verbosePreference = 'Continue' to view the collection process

Returns Group information
This simple function wraps the Get-QADGroup cmdlet and returns the core information used by IT to determine group purpose, ownership & membership
The name, or partial name, of the group
Connects to an IIS formated log file and returns it as an object
Parses through the first part of the log file and determines the headers. If the service has been restarted, and different headers appear in the middle of the log, they will be ignored
The file to process
The file to process

Takes string input and outputs a secure string
This function takes input from a paramter or from the host. It then processes this string into a secure string. This is useful for storing passwords in a script or function.
This is a string value that will be transformed into a secure string.
This is a string value that will be transformed into a secure string.
Returns the number of days the service has been running.

This function queries via WMI any system and returns the number of days a particular service has been running. This is different from when the system was last rebooted, in that services may be restarted much more frequently.
The shortname of the service to check
The shortname of the service to check

Creates Groups in accordance to proper naming standards
Creates Active Directory groups, and validates the proper standard: (xxxxx) yyyyyy {zzzzz} xxxxx = The Server or System Name yyyyy = The component name zzzzz = The Rights or permissions

The OU the group will be placed
The description of the group
The user that is responsible for approving changes to the group

The OU the group will be placed

The user that is responsible for approving changes to the group

maml:description.maml:para: Tests if the user is an administrator
Returns true if a user is an administrator, false if the user is not an administrator

dev:remarks.maml:para: ResultDetails : System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity Result : False Parameters : none Hostname : localhost TestName : Test-IsAdministrator
ResultDetails : System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity Result : True Parameters : none Hostname : localhost TestName : Test-IsAdministrator

maml:description.maml:para: A basic port scanner
This script will attempt to connect to a single port on a single IP address
This is the IPv4 Address of the remote system
This is the Port number to attempt to connect to
This argument determines whether the function tests connectivity to the host via ping prior to testing port connection.

dev:remarks.maml:para: ResultDetails : System.Net.Sockets.TcpClient Result : True Parameters : {[hostname, www.google.com], [port, 80]} Hostname : www.google.com TestName : Test-Port

maml:description.maml:para: Transforms an IP Range into a list of IP Addresses
In several cases, a range of IP Addresses will need to be converted from a range to a list of IP Addresses
A range of IP Addresses. The format should be: x.x.x.x-y.y.y.y -or- x.x.x.x - y.y.y.y
Returns a list of active user accounts
Queries the Remote Desktop Gateway WMI object and returns a list of users and resources that are in use.
The name of the Remote Desktop Gateway server
[Optional] Credentials required to connect to the Remote Desktop Gateway system
Returns the status of an account, and optionally unlocks it

In certain conditions, it may be required to keep an account from locking due to misconfigured passwords. For example, when a service account is changed and other that use the same account are missed, resulting in a series of uncontrolled account lockouts.
This cmdlet can be schedule to run and automatically unlock the account and send out notifications.
WARNING: This cmdlet should ONLY be used a temporary measure when an account is locked out and jeopordizes system availability.
The samAccountName of the account to check

The email address, or addresses, to send if the cmdlet unlocks an account
Multiple email addresses should be provided as a comma seperated list
Specifies whether the account should be unlocked when the script is run

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires the Quest Active directory tools to be available on the system.

dev:remarks.maml:para:
<email> First Name: USER Last Name : ACOUNT samAccountName: USER1
Existing Status: -------------------------------- Locked Out: True Bad Password Count: 0 Bad Password Time: 10/26/2016 15:51:24
New Status: -------------------------------- Locked Out: False Bad Password Count: 0 Bad Password Time: 10/26/2016 15:51:24 </email>

Checks the status of SQL TDE Encryption
The hostname of the target server, hosting the SQL database
The database to query for the encryption status
The hostname of the target server, hosting the SQL database
The database to query for the encryption status

command:example.maml:title: EXAMPLE 1
command:example.dev:code:
C:\PS> get-databaseEncryptionStatus -hostname MOLINATEST | format-table
EncryptionStateRaw Database Algorithm KeyLength ServerName EncryptionState ------------------ -------- --------- --------- ---------- --------------- 3 tempdb AES 256 MOLINATEST Encrypted 3 MI_UT_Staging AES 256 MOLINATEST Encrypted 3 MI_UT AES 256 MOLINATEST Encrypted 3 Mol_UT_Source AES 256 MOLINATEST Encrypted
